content:
Drug: Meperidine | cid: 4058
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Meperidine (Demerol) including uses, images, dosage, effects, legal status, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: meperidine
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Donate and receive yours!

Meperidine



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Demerol; Isonipecaine; Pethidine; Mepergan

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Analgesic

CHEMICAL NAME

1-methyl-4-phenylisonipecotic acid ethyl ester

DESCRIPTION

Meperidine is a synthetic opioid analgesic used for the relief of moderate to severe pain. It is also prescribed off-label for the treatment of shivering.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

RELATED VAULTS #

Opiates Vault

Heroin Vault

EXPERIENCES #

Vein honey, by Charlie

The Bloody Mess, by Acid Rain

Effects of a Non-fatal Overdose, by Former Opiate Fan

Snorting Meperidine, Take 2: Pain v. Pleasure, by john_iv

I Was Able to Stay Awake and Enjoy the Full Ride, by slswtf

» » » MORE » » »

OFF-SITE RESOURCES

PRIMARY RESOURCES #

MedlinePlus : Meperidine

SECONDARY RESOURCES #

Demerol - TripSit.me

                    Context: 
                    This section provides an overview of Meperidine (Demerol), a synthetic opioid analgesic, as part of Erowid’s Pharmaceuticals Index. It includes its common and chemical names, effects classification, description, links to related substance vaults, personal experience reports, and relevant external resources.
